title: Full Location Tag Workflow
text: recommend downloading data Geofabrik, hosts regularly updated OpenStreetMap data. required files osm.pbf files. homepage allows downloading data whole continents; clicking continent name go list sub regions (usually country); sub regions can clicked reveal even finer grained divisions. example, clicking South America Brazil provide list sub regions Brazil. See guidelines downloading data directly R, using osmextract package, might useful certain cases. Importantly, save backup map data allow reproducibility, online map data changes time. also means map data downloaded close time location data collected.

title: Full Location Tag Workflow
text: downloaded appropriate files, ’re ready generate tags. need provide directory one osm.pbf files, distance location want search tags, locations . Note distances provided using units package: distances meters can provided using syntax shown (units::set_units(10, m) distance 10 meters), advanced options can found units package documentation. can see, data tells us locations close ocean, first commercial area, around hotel restauarant, second next unrecognized building. ensure uniqueness, tags composed OpenStreetMap tag key value, separated underscore. information tags can found OpenStreetMap wiki.
code: library(privlocR)  # Directory that contains pbf files (the R temporary dir in this case) mydir <- tempdir()  # The distance around each location in which we want to search for tags mydst = units::set_units(100, m)  #longitude and latitude values long = c(-9.1979860, -9.192079) lat = c(-171.8501176, -171.856883)  get_close_tags(mydir, long, lat, dst = mydst) #> Re-reading with feature count reset from 52 to 29 #> Re-reading with feature count reset from 4 to 2 #> [[1]] #> [1] "landuse_residential" "amenity_restaurant"  "natural_reef"        #> [4] "natural_coastline"   "natural_scrub"       "tourism_hotel"       #> [7] "leisure_park"        "building_yes"        #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "natural_reef"      "natural_coastline" "natural_water"     #> [4] "natural_wood"      "building_yes"

title: Full Location Tag Workflow
text: Run times privlocR dependant amount map data provided - provide map data whole continent privlocR take long time run even data concentrated single country even city. Importantly, files provided directory scanned, contribute runtime. running several analyses concentrated different geographical areas, map data relevant current analysis provided directory. privlocR provides limited caching - running exact analysis , analysis exact parameters except reduced distance, analysis much faster. , want taglists multiple distances (e.g., one taglist characterize broad area around location one identify specific places), start larger distance take care change parameter, : Now see first location specifically hotel restaurant, second location, know previous analysis building vicinity, location open.
code: # The distance around each location in which we want to search for tags mydst2 = units::set_units(10, m)  #calling again, only changing the distance get_close_tags(mydir, long, lat, dst = mydst2) #> [[1]] #> [1] "landuse_residential" "amenity_restaurant"  "natural_reef"        #> [4] "natural_coastline"   "tourism_hotel"       "building_yes"        #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "natural_reef"      "natural_coastline"

what: Which size of region should I work with?
title: Full Location Tag Workflow
text: time, remember whole goal privlocR disclose locations looking online - downloading data tiny village might let someone know participant . rule thumb, working 0.5 gb map data - medium-sized country (e.g., Cameroon) state sub region larger one (e.g., region India) - manageable modern computer. Working around multiple gigabytes data - larger country whole continent (e.g., South America) might take hour first run. cases try make sure get required locations one go, multiple distances required start largest distance take advantage caching system.

title: Full Location Tag Workflow
text: Data can also downloaded directly R using package osmextract. example, download data Tokelau used package examples, one can run: (Note allow_gpkg = FALSE tells function download osm.pbf file; function can also download .gpkg file used privlocR) function returns filename temporary files, copied persistent directory backup. osmextract tries find file matches location provided, can name country, region city. Theoretically, locations contained within single city, download might smaller using osmextract using geofabrik geofabrik allows download relatively large regions (osmextract searches additional repositories beyond geofabrik). However, small cities might found , usually region found geofabrik contains city prohibitively large. information can found osmextract documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Haran Sened. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. European Research Council. Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sened H (2024). “privlocR: Offline Reproducible Privacy Preserving Location Analysis.” R Package.
code: @Unpublished{,   title = {privlocR: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis},   author = {Haran Sened},   year = {2024},   note = {R Package}, }

what: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
title: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
text: goal privlocR obtain meaningful tags location data obtained research, translating list longitudes latitudes list meaningful tags describing found near various locations (e.g., shop, coastline, restaurant). Researchers fitting participants wearables collecting location data smartphones can obtain coordinates participant location time1. However, given coordinates participant’s location specific time, interesting know whether participant residential building, shop, forest, next sea. privlocR uses freely available, openly licensed data OpenStreetMap project2 obtain information easily, freely, privately, reproducibly: Easily, package hopefully easy use. Freely, data OpenStreetMap publicly available free. Privately, data sent online service. Reproducibly, running privlocR downloaded map files always return results, even online map data changes. Additionally, privlocR code available understand location data analysed. contrast using commercial services provide APIs can obtain information specific locations (see, example, function google_places googleway package). APIs usually require setting paid accounts various services, adds complexity cost; data sent services, create privacy risks; analysis reproducible online services update maps, code available.

title: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
text: can install development version privlocR GitHub :

title: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
text: Generating tags set locations simple placing .osm.pbf map data file, can downloaded Geofabrik, directory; selecting distance around location search tags; running get_close_tags function. following example gets location tags 100 meters less two specified locations: can see, data tells us locations close ocean, first commercial area, around hotel restauarant, second next unrecognized building. Additional information including ways download map data, well advice regarding performance see full tag workflow vignette.
code: library(privlocR)  # Directory that contains pbf files (the R temporary dir in this case) mydir <- tempdir()  # Populate the directory with map file(s) downloaded from OpenStreetMap file.copy(system.file("extdata", "tokelau.osm.pbf", package = "privlocR"), mydir) #> [1] TRUE  # The distance around each location in which we want to search for tags mydst = units::set_units(100, m)  # Example longitude and latitude values long = c(-9.1979860, -9.192079) lat = c(-171.8501176, -171.856883)  get_close_tags(mydir, long, lat, dst = mydst) #> Re-reading with feature count reset from 52 to 29 #> Re-reading with feature count reset from 4 to 2 #> [[1]] #> [1] "landuse_residential" "amenity_restaurant"  "natural_reef"        #> [4] "natural_coastline"   "natural_scrub"       "tourism_hotel"       #> [7] "leisure_park"        "building_yes"        #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "natural_reef"      "natural_coastline" "natural_water"     #> [4] "natural_wood"      "building_yes"

title: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
text: additional ways obtain meaning data, including clustering (.e., identifying participants “place” time time B) assessing mobility (e.g., estimating distance traveled participant every day). Future versions planned include additional analyses, providing standard way extract variety features location data.

title: Offline Reproducible and Privacy Preserving Location Analysis
text: project received funding European Union’s Horizon 2020 research innovation programme Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement 101023860.

what: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
title: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
text: get_close_tags() returns relevant tags certain distance location, giving meaningful sense type place person without providing exact data. data sent online. repeated queries performed directory tags smaller distance, analysis drawn cache analysis time greatly reduced.

title: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
code: get_close_tags(   pbfdir,   lat,   long,   layers = DEFAULT_LAYERS,   tags = DEFAULT_TAGS,   dst = units::set_units(100, m),   refilter_data = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
text: pbfdir File directory .osm.pbf files containing map data relevant area. directory must writeable processing function create temporary files directory, delete . lat numeric vector latitudes long numeric vector longitudes layers relevant layers pbf files (touch familiar OpenStreetMap data) tags location tags interest (touch familiar OpenStreetMap data) dst max distance location look tags refilter_data forcefully ignore cache quiet less verbose function output

title: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
text: list vectors tags, one location

title: Get tags close to a series of locations — get_close_tags
code: mydir <- withr::local_tempdir() file.copy(system.file("extdata", "tokelau.osm.pbf", package = "privlocR"), mydir) #> [1] TRUE get_close_tags(mydir, c(-9.1979860, -9.192079), c(-171.8501176, -171.856883)) #> Error: Cannot open "/tmp/RtmpduIgqE/file1a182771db48.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist. get_close_tags(mydir, c(-9.1979860, -9.192079), c(-171.8501176, -171.856883),       dst = units::set_units(10,m)) #> Error: Cannot open "/tmp/RtmpduIgqE/file1a182771db48.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist. get_close_tags(mydir, c(-9.1979860, -9.192079), c(-171.8501176, -171.856883),       dst = units::set_units(10,m), tags = c("amenity","landuse")) #> Warning: cannot remove file '/tmp/RtmpduIgqE/file1a182771db48.gpkg', reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error: Cannot open "/tmp/RtmpduIgqE/file1a18721d89f6.gpkg"; The file doesn't seem to exist.
